A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I've seen it twice now and it might very well go down as my second favorite Star Wars film. I thought Episode VII was weak and was very happy that this threw away most of what I didn't like about it. Star Wars was all over this film and you could tell Rian was a fan. He did a great job bringing in the spirit of Star Wars while not making it a carbon copy like JJ did. People are going to whine because their fan theories weren't realized and because it dared to do something different. That's fine. I loved it and personally think it will go down as one of the best.
